description: The TTP223 is a touch pad detector IC that provides a single touch key with low power consumption and a wide operating voltage range (2.0 V to 5.5 V). It supports multiple output modes (CMOS, open‑drain, direct, toggle) and offers fast and low‑power operation, adjustable sensitivity, and optional maximum key‑on duration.

specifications.response_time: Fast mode: ~60 ms; Low‑power mode: ~220 ms (at VDD = 3 V)
specifications.current_consumption: Typical 1.5 µA (low‑power, no load), 3.5 µA (fast, no load); Max 13 µA (fast, no load)
other: Sensitivity adjustable via external capacitance (0 pF – 50 pF)
Fast/Low‑power mode selectable via LPMB pin
Toggle/Direct mode selectable via TOG pin
Active high/low selectable via AHLB pin
Maximum key‑on duration selectable via MOTB pin (up to 100 s)
Sampling length selectable via SLRFTB pin (1.6 ms or 3.2 ms)

power.consumption: Typical 1.5 µA (low‑power, no load); 3.5 µA (fast, no load)

pins.Data: Q (CMOS output, pin 1) or OPDO (open‑drain output, pin 2)
pins.Other: LPMB, TOG, AHLB, RST, SLRFTB, MOTB, I (sensor input)

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VDD to supply voltage (2.0 V–5.5 V), VSS to ground, pad to pin I, and read the output from pin Q (or OPDO). Configure the desired mode pins (LPMB, TOG, AHLB, MOTB, SLRFTB, RST) as per application requirements.

example_code.explaination: Simple Arduino sketch that reads the touch state from the Q pin and prints it to the serial monitor.
